maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday September 12, 2024 at 14:37

did.abstract: The Colorado Congregational Conference was founded in the 19th century and functioned as the primary state-level Congregational organization within Colorado. Numerous ministerial associations formed within Colorado and included the Eastern Association, the Arkansas Valley Association, the Denver Association, the Northwestern Association, and the Western Colorado Association. During the 1960s, the Colorado Conference merged with state level conferences from Utah and Wyoming to form the Rocky Mountain Conference of the United Church of Christ. This collection contains records related to the Rocky Mountain Conference, its predecessor conferences, especially the Colorado Congregational Conference, related state Congregational conferences, and regional associations within Colorado. The majority of records are meeting minutes for conferences and associations, programs for conference and association activities, financial records, correspondence and communications, and legal records.

corpname.part: United Church of Christ. Rocky Mountain Conference

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Rocky Mountain Conference records, 1876-2010, RG5424. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated to the Congregational Library & Archives by the Rocky Mountain Conference, August 2021; 2021-07, 2021-10.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Zachary Bodnar, September 2024, using Describing Archives: A Content Standard.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Colorado Congregational Conference was founded in the 19th century and functioned as the primary state-level Congregational organization within Colorado. The Colorado Congregational Conference also worked closely with the Board of Home Missions and the Extension Board to support and supply the churches within Colorado. Numerous ministerial associations formed within Colorado and included the Eastern Association, the Arkansas Valley Association, the Denver Association, the Northwestern Association, and the Western Colorado Association. The Colorado Conference also included numerous German Background Congregational churches. During the 1960s, the Colorado Conference merged with state level conferences from Utah and Wyoming to form the Rocky Mountain Conference of the United Church of Christ. The Rocky Mountain Conference continues today and has its headquarters in Denver. Under the Rocky Mountain Conference are modern day equivalents to the associations that existed in the past: the Metro Denver Association, the Platte Valley Association, the Western Colorado Association, the Southeast Association, and the Intermountain Association.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains records related to the Rocky Mountain Conference, its predecessor conferences, especially the Colorado Congregational Conference, related state Congregational conferences, and regional associations within Colorado. The records document the proceedings of these conferences and associations. The majority of records are meeting minutes for conferences and associations, programs for conference and association activities, financial records, correspondence and communications, and legal records. The collection contains records specifically related to the German Congregational churches within Colorado. The collection also contains a scrapbook documenting the local activities of the women's fellowship of the Rocky Mountain Conference.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials within this collection have been arranged into the three series listed below. Materials within the Colorado Congregational Conference records have been further organized into three subseries. Within each series, materials have generally been organized into chronological order. Directly related materials have been arranged together. Original order has largely been maintained for materials within each folder; as a result, contents within folders are rarely in chronological order.
Series 2: Other state conferences and associations, 1892-1983

corpname.part: United Church of Christ. Rocky Mountain Conference

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to the Colorado Congregational Conference as well as the regional Associations that worked under the state Conference. The series also contains records specifically related to the German Background churches which were a part of the Colorado Congregational Conference. The collection contains meeting minutes, reports, correspondence, and programs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records related to the Colorado Congregational Conference, and some other state-level Congregational records for the state of Colorado. This subseries contains meeting minutes, reports, board of directors' records, financial records, legal records, especially land deeds, records from the Colorado Home Missionary Society, records from the Extension Board, and communications with some churches.

did.unittitle: Colorado Congregational Association Board of Directors records
Colorado Congregational Association annual meeting minutes
Third Church, Denver, communications and clippings
Second Church, Denver, communications and clippings
Colorado Conference board of directors minutes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records from the regional associations that functioned under the Colorado Congregational Conference. The associations represented in this subseries include the Arkansas Valley Association, Denver Association, Eastern Association, Northwestern Association, and Western Association. The records largely contain meeting minutes, programs, reports, and a significant collection of correspondence from the Denver Association.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Loose materials found within this volume were removed and placed into the folder titled "Northwestern Association records, 1933-1956" for preservation purposes.

did.unittitle: Denver Association of Congregational Churches and Ministers records
Colorado Western Association of Congregational Ministers and Churches records

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Materials within this folder were removed from the volume titled "Eastern Association records, 1901-1959" for preservation purposes.

did.unittitle: Western Colorado Association records: Union Congregational Church on Montrose

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records specifically related to the German Background churches which were a part of the Colorado Congregational Conference. The subseries also contains communications with the Zion German Church in Montrose, Colorado, as well as records related to mission work with the German background churches.

did.unittitle: Northeastern association of the Colorado Conference annual reports
Colorado Congregational Conference (German Background Churches) minutes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records of Congregational conferences and associations from Idaho, Oregon, Utah, and Wyoming. The Rocky Mountain Conference of the UCC today includes Colorado, Utah, Wyoming. This series includes legal records, especially land deeds, financial records, records of conference and association meetings, constitutions, and programs.

did.unittitle: Idaho and Utah Conference financial records

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to the Rocky Mountain Conference. The series includes one volume of financial records, a scrapbook documenting the local activities, at the church level, of the Women's Fellowship of the Rocky Mountain Conference, and a gavel related to the Women's Fellowship.
